name: Water Bear
description: Tardigrades, known colloquially as water bears or moss piglets, are a phylum of eight-legged segmented micro-animals. They are known for their ability to survive in extreme environments that would be fatal to most life forms.
habitat: Tardigrades are found in a variety of environments, from the deep sea to mountaintops, and from tropical rainforests to the Antarctic.

name: Diatom
description: Diatoms are a major group of algae and are among the most common types of phytoplankton. They are unicellular organisms with unique cell walls made of silica (hydrated silicon dioxide).
habitat: Diatoms are found in the oceans, freshwater, soils, and on damp surfaces. They are especially important in oceans, where they are estimated to contribute up to 45% of the total oceanic primary production.

name: Rotifer
description: Rotifers are microscopic aquatic animals that make up the phylum Rotifera. They are characterized by a rotating wheel of cilia at their head, which is used for locomotion and feeding.
habitat: Rotifers are common in freshwater environments throughout the world; a few species are found in saltwater.

name: Bread Mold
description: A common mold that grows on bread and other food items. It's characterized by its fluffy white or gray appearance with black spore-bearing structures.
habitat: Found on decaying organic matter, particularly bread and fruits.

name: Amoeba
description: A single-celled organism that constantly changes shape as it moves and feeds. It uses pseudopodia, temporary extensions of the cell, to capture food and move.
habitat: Found in freshwater environments like ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams.

name: E. coli
description: A gram-negative, rod-shaped bacterium commonly found in the lower intestine of warm-blooded organisms. Most strains are harmless, but some can cause food poisoning in humans.
habitat: Primarily found in the intestines of humans and animals, but can also survive in the environment.
